org.owasp.dependencycheck.utils

Class HttpResourceConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.owasp.dependencycheck.utils.HttpResourceConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class HttpResourceConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A utility to download files from the Internet.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Jeremy Long

    • Method Detail

      • fetch

        public java.io.InputStream fetch(java.net.URL url)
                          throws DownloadFailedException,
                                 TooManyRequestsException,
                                 ResourceNotFoundException
        Retrieves the resource identified by the given URL and returns the InputStream.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to download
        Returns:
        the stream to read the retrieved content from
        Throws:
        DownloadFailedException - is thrown if there is an error downloading the resource
        TooManyRequestsException - thrown when a 429 is received
        ResourceNotFoundException - thrown when a 404 is received

      • close

        public void close()

        Releases the underlying HTTP URL Connection.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether or not the connection has been closed.
        Returns:
        whether or not the connection has been closed

      • checkForCommonExceptionTypes

        public void checkForCommonExceptionTypes(java.io.IOException ex)
                                  throws DownloadFailedException
        Analyzes the IOException, logs the appropriate information for debugging purposes, and then throws a DownloadFailedException that wraps the IO Exception for common IO Exceptions. This is to provide additional details to assist in resolution of the exception.
        Parameters:
        ex - the original exception
        Throws:
        DownloadFailedException - a wrapper exception that contains the original exception as the cause
